segments.text: The kitchen looks so ordinary at first glance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I notice the faucet blasting water into the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's overflowing, cascading down like a waterfall onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The lady's drying dishes, completely oblivious to the flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's probably getting soaked soon without her knowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now, those two kids are raiding the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's perched on that unstable stool, reaching in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: One wrong move and he'll tumble right down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's all excited, arm up begging for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's kind of cute how they're teaming up on this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the wet floor makes everything riskier.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden's calm; wish the inside was too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the mom; she's missing all this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Hope no one gets hurt in this little adventure.
segments.speaker: PAR
